an7.2:1.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities is disliked and disapproved by their spiritual companions, not respected or admired.
an7.2:1.3: It’s when a mendicant desires material possessions, honor, and to be looked up to. They lack conscience and prudence. They’re jealous and stingy.
an7.2:1.4: A mendicant with these seven qualities is disliked and disapproved by their spiritual companions, not respected or admired.
an7.2:2.1: A mendicant with seven qualities is liked and approved by their spiritual companions, respected and admired.
an7.2:2.3: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t desire material possessions, honor, and to be looked up to. They have conscience and prudence. They’re not jealous or stingy.
an7.2:2.4: A mendicant with these seven qualities is liked and approved by their spiritual companions, respected and admired.”
